citations.narrative:
Housing areas for the non-human primates are in need of clearing of accumulations of weeds and other items not
necessary for daily cleaning and husbandry practices.
*There are stored items including a rusty metal box and unused enclosures inside the monkey building.
*There is an overgrowth of weeds in the outdoor portion of the snow macaque enclosure.
An accumulation of weeds and cluttered items/equipment makes it more difficult to clean the affected areas and to
provide proper husbandry as required by the regulations.
The facility shall ensure that housing facilities are free of any accumulation of trash, junk, weeds, stored
equipment/furniture not necessary for proper husbandry and discarded materials. Correct by 10/1/23.

The metal pipe used as a conduit for the snow macaque to move from the indoor sheltered and outdoor areas of his
enclosure has developed rust on the bottom surface of the pipe. A small hole (approximate estimate about 1.5 in x 1 in) is
visible in the rusted area about 6 inches from the outside end of the pipe on the bottom surface of the pipe. Rusted metal
surfaces are not able to be cleaned and sanitized appropriately and over time will lose structural integrity causing damage
to the surface that may injure the animal.
The facility shall ensure that the metal pipes used by the monkeys to access indoor/outdoor areas of their enclosures
have surfaces that are in good repair and free of excessive rust that prevents the required cleaning and sanitization or
that affects the structural strength of the metal surface. Correct by 11/30/23.

citations.desc: Cleaning, sanitization, housekeeping, and pest control.
citations.narrative:
The marmoset enclosure in the monkey building housing two marmosets is in need of cleaning. The bars, shelves and
bottom tray of the enclosure are dirty with accumulations of excreta and food waste. Small flies were noted in the building.
Daily spot cleaning of all hard surfaces is necessary to prevent an excessive accumulation of excreta and food wastes, to
prevent the marmosets from becoming soiled and to reduce disease hazards, insects, pests and odors.
The marmoset enclosure including the bars, shelves, and trays need to be cleaned. Correct by 9/20/23.
This inspection and exit interview were conducted with the facility representative.
n

narrative:
3.75(b) 
   
Housing facilities, general. 
Housing areas for the non-human primates are in need of clearing of accumulations of weeds and other items not 
necessary for daily cleaning and husbandry practices.  
*There are stored items including a rusty metal box and unused enclosures inside the monkey building.  
*There is an overgrowth of weeds in the outdoor portion of the snow macaque enclosure.  
An accumulation of weeds and cluttered items/equipment makes it more difficult to clean the affected areas and to 
provide proper husbandry as required by the regulations.  
The facility shall ensure that housing facilities are free of any accumulation of trash, junk, weeds, stored 
equipment/furniture not necessary for proper husbandry and discarded materials. Correct by 10/1/23. 
3.75(c)(1)(i) 
   
Housing facilities, general. 
The metal pipe used as a conduit for the snow macaque to move from the indoor sheltered and outdoor areas of his 
enclosure has developed rust on the bottom surface of the pipe. A small hole (approximate estimate about 1.5 in x 1 in) is 
visible in the rusted area about 6 inches from the outside end of the pipe on the bottom surface of the pipe. Rusted metal 
surfaces are not able to be cleaned and sanitized appropriately and over time will lose structural integrity causing damage 
to the surface that may injure the animal.  
The facility shall ensure that the metal pipes used by the monkeys to access indoor/outdoor areas of their enclosures 
have surfaces that are in good repair and free of excessive rust that prevents the required cleaning and sanitization or 
that affects the structural strength of the metal surface. Correct by 11/30/23. 
3.84(a) 
   
Cleaning, sanitization, housekeeping, and pest control. 
The marmoset enclosure in the monkey building housing two marmosets is in need of cleaning. The bars, shelves and 
bottom tray of the enclosure are dirty with accumulations of excreta and food waste. Small flies were noted in the building.  
Daily spot cleaning of all hard surfaces is necessary to prevent an excessive accumulation of excreta and food wastes, to 
prevent the marmosets from becoming soiled and to reduce disease hazards, insects, pests and odors.  
The marmoset enclosure including the bars, shelves, and trays need to be cleaned. Correct by 9/20/23.

This inspection and exit interview were conducted with the facility representative.

species.common: DOMESTIC PIG / POTBELLY PIG / MICRO PIG
